metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2374 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
An exploitable memory corruption vulnerability exists in the handling ofthe MXIT protocol in Pidgin. Specially crafted MXIT MultiMX message sentvia the server can result in an out-of-bounds write leading to memorydisclosure and code execution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2374` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

finch - 1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.3
libpurple-bin - 1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.3
libpurple0 - 1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.3
pidgin - 1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.3
pidgin-data - 1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: pidgin package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.3').
